content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 §§ 635-6.5 - Costs of co-operative (see glossary, Subpart 635-99 of this Part) ownership of real estate

State Regulations
(a) If an agreement
to purchase membership or ownership interest in a co-operative, which agreement
has been approved by OPWDD and the New York State Division of Budget, is
between the provider or an individual and a party which is not a related party, allowable costs shall be the lesser of the actual purchase price or the price
of a membership or ownership interest in a co-operative for real estate with
similar functions in the same geographic area. (b) If an agreement to purchase membership or
ownership interest in a co-operative, which agreement has been approved by
OPWDD and the New York State Division of Budget, is between the provider or an
individual and a related party, allowable costs for such purchase shall be the
least of: (1)
the actual purchase
price; (2)
the price of membership
or ownership interest in a co-operative with similar functions in the same
geographic area; or
(3)
the
co-operative's costs attributable to the provider or individual. (c) The allowable cost of
purchasing membership or ownership interest in a co-operative shall be
amortized over 15 years, or the term of the mortgage given by the provider or
individual, whichever is greater. Notes
